page.title: 07The Turkey Farm.
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Chandler own "Quornland Turkeys" Farm.It is on the Six Hills road with their house close to the road and the turkey sheds behind. They have 10,000 turkeys and 10,000 chickens.When the turkeys are fully grown and ready for market they are put into a special pen.Each one is taken out and hung up by the feet.It is then killed and put through the plucking machine.It is hung up again and any feathers which have been missed are pulled out.The turkeys are then gutted and their heads chopped off.They are washed out and put into plastic bags.They are put into crates and stored in freezers.They are mainly sold at Christmas and Easter.The turkey eggs are put on trays, stored in a cool shed and then put into incubators to hatch out as replacements.
